body: Thanks for the improvement @akshar-raaj !

I don't think it is an indent error, check https://docs.python.org/2/tutorial/controlflow.html#break-and-continue-statements-and-else-clauses-on-loops. But this `else` seems unnecessary; just `return item` should do the same.
thanks!
thanks @willingc!

Sounds good.

Should we also add the Scrapy 0.24 requirement to setup.py and a requirements.txt file?. May also be worth mentioning the required version in the README.

Agree. 

I also think that the example project (and the tutorial) should show how to yield scrapy.Request and use callbacks other than the default 'parse', and how to use custom 'start_requests' - it is not clear how Scrapy works from this demo project. But that's another issue :)
www

I'm not sure if changing the `xpath()` approach to `css()` is a good idea. Throughout the whole tutorial we use xpath and xpath seems to be the default in general. Also I'm pretty sure css is being converted to xpath anyways so css selectors aren't even a real thing #xpathmasterrace :)

@Granitas , indeed, CSS selectors are converted to XPath. And XPath is more powerful as you can go in any direction, even upwards, and have complex predicates and use string functions.
Though, the killer feature of CSS Selectors to me is `.classname`, which is quite handy here for dmoz. The extra trailing space here:

```
<div class="site-item ">
```

is easy to get wrong.
The equivalent XPath is so ugly IMO (`descendant::div[@class and contains(concat(' ', normalize-space(@class), ' '), ' site-item ')]`)
`:nth-*(odd/even)` is also nice and shorter than with XPath, yet less useful.

Probably dmoz is not the best website to use for an XPath tutorial in the end.
There's an open issue about this on parsel: https://github.com/scrapy/parsel/issues/13

This looks good.

Would be good to remove `from scrapy.selector import Selector` from `dmoz.py`, though.

Hey @paulojblack, thanks so much for the PR!
Sorry for taking long to handle this -- your changes were incorporated in #21 which also added PY3 compatibility.
Thanks a bunch! :+1: :+1:

Hi @halldor, thanks for the PR, sorry for taking long to handle this!
We've merged #21 which fixes for the website changes and also adds Python 3 compatibility, and we're starting a new [quotesbot project](https://github.com/scrapy/quotesbot) that will use quotes.toscrape.com just like the newly updated tutorial and will be better maintained.
Thanks again!! :+1:

Hi, @zhugezuo, thanks for the fix !
We've ended up merging #21 which adds PY3 compatibility too.
Also, we're creating a [new project for the examples](https://github.com/scrapy/quotesbot) that will use quotes.toscrape.com just like the newly updated tutorial, which will help avoiding this problem in the future.
Thanks again!

Hello @andrewpost, thanks for the PR!
Sorry for taking long to handle this, we've merged #21 which fixes for the website changes among other code improvements.
We're starting a new project [quotesbot](https://github.com/scrapy/quotesbot) that will use the same website used in the newly updated Scrapy tutorial.
Thanks again!!

Hey @WiseDoge !
Sorry for taking so long to finally handle this!

We've merged #21 which fixes the spider for the website changes among other code improvements.
We're also starting a new project [quotesbot](https://github.com/scrapy/quotesbot) that will use the same website used in the newly updated Scrapy tutorial.

Thanks again!! :+1: :+1:

No problem. I have to admit I didn't even check if there was already a PR with a fix for this. I just thought nobody cared enough.

Good news. Scrapy is a great project and deserves good demos and documentation.

Thanks for the heads up @mjrao !
I've updated the README with a deprecation notice.

@kmike , I've marked this project as deprecated.
I'm cleaning things up.

@mjrao , you can of course advertize a fork of yours into a dmoztools.net spider project.
It's just that Scrapy team will not be maintaining this outdated educational dmoz.org spider.
thanks for your reply.

Hey @jonjack , it's great that you learned Scrapy that way!
As you understood, this `dirbot` repository is now deprecated and the Scrapy team has no intention of changing the codebase. Indeed, we're promoting https://github.com/scrapy/quotesbot
Feel free to advertize your fork for other users coming to Scrapy from dirbot (there's a new [/r/scrapy/](https://www.reddit.com/r/scrapy/) if you want to post there)
@redapple no worries

* add "main.py"  to  quick start
* change "www.dmoz.org" to "dmoztools.net"

Hello @baitercel ,
I'm afraid this repository is now deprecated. Please see the [deprecation notice in the README](https://github.com/scrapy/dirbot/blob/master/README.rst).
The Scrapy team will not accept patches to it anymore.
An equivalent education scrapy project is now at https://github.com/scrapy/quotesbot
l see , think u
